text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
SOTT1ExposureContacts 0..*BackboneElementThis is an abstract type.
Elements defined in Ancestors: @id, extension, modifierExtension
Surveillance & Outbreak Toolkit T1 Exposure - Contacts
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference
interviewerName 0..1stringInterviewer name (Exposures)
interviewerTitle 0..1stringFunction or title interviewer (Exposures)
noOfHouseholdMembers 0..1QuantityHow many household members do you living with ?
sickHouseholdMember 0..1codeDo you have any household members with similar illness or symptoms ?
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
HouseholdMemberDetails 0..*BackboneElementDescribe details of sick house hold member
DateOfOnset 0..1dateDate of onset
NameAndDOB 0..1stringName and date of birth
relationship 0..1stringRelationship
sickContact 0..1codeAre you aware of people outside your household with similar illness or symptoms ?
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
ContactDetails 0..*BackboneElementDescribe details of sick contact
DateOfOnset 0..1dateDate of onset
nameAndRelationship 0..1stringName and relationship
placeOfInteraction 0..1stringPlace of interaction

Documentation for this format

name: SOTT1ExposureContacts
title: Surveillance & Outbreak Toolkit T1 Exposure - Contacts

element.short: Surveillance & Outbreak Toolkit T1 Exposure - Contacts
element.definition: Base definition for all elements that are defined inside a resource - but not those in a data type.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: Entre the function or title of the person filling in this section 'Exposures' of the questionnaire. It can be the same or a different person conducting the previous sections
Entre the name of the person filling in this section 'Exposures' of the questionnaire. It can be the same or a different person conducting the previous sections

element.short: How many household members do you living with ?
element.definition: Respondent's number of household members (definition of household to be locally decided - might need to be set to total number for the month)

element.short: Do you have any household members with similar illness or symptoms ?
element.definition: Indicates if there are any other household members currently ill with a similar illness or sick with a similar illness in the last XX weeks/months

element.short: Describe details of sick house hold member
element.definition: Describe details of sick house hold member

element.definition: When did your first household member become sick?
What was his/her age and name
What was his/her relationship with the patient

element.short: Are you aware of people outside your household with similar illness or symptoms ?
element.definition: Indicates if the respondent aware of any other community members (not listed as a household member) who are currently sick with a similar illness or were sick with one recently.
Describe details of sick contact
